document.docAuthor: Khanjani, Mohammad, Fayaz, Bahman Asali & Ghanbalani, Gadir Nori
document.docTitle: Neophyllobius kamalii Khanjani, Fayaz & Ghanbalani, 2010, sp. nov.
document.masterDocTitle: Two new species of the genus Neophyllobius Berlese (Acari: Camerobiidae) from Iran

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: Two new species of the genus Neophyllobius Berlese (Acari: Camerobiidae) from Iran

subSubSection.paragraph:
Male (n= 5 ).
Dimensions (variations in measurements of paratypes in parentheses): Length including gnathosoma 400 ( 319–400 ), width 220 ( 208–220 ). See more details of measurements in Table 1 .

Venter (
Fig. 15
). Coxal setae narrow and almost smooth, setae
1a 25
( 24–36 ), Anogenital area with one pair of aggenital setae ( ag ) and three pairs of anal setae ( ps
1-4
) (
Fig. 15
). Length of ventral setae:
1a 25
( 24– 36 ),
1 b
21 ( 16–21 ),
1 c
35 ( 34–38 ),
2 c
41 ( 38–42 ),
3a 34
( 30–37 ),

30 ( 25–37 ),
4a 34
( 25–40 ),

22 ( 21– 24 ). Anogenital setae: ag 20 ( 19–34 ), ps
1
10 ( 10–14 ), ps

14 ( 10–15 ). Aedeagus is depicted on
Fig. 15
.

Legs . Measurements of leg I 585 ( 563–590 ), leg II 523 ( 500–525 ), leg III 562 ( 535–575 ), leg IV 645 ( 660– 665 ). Chaetotaxy of leg segments (coxae to tarsi) as follows (solenidia in parentheses and not included in setal counts): coxae 3 - 1-2 - 2 , trochanters 1 - 1 - 1 - 1 , femora 4 - 3 - 2 - 2 , genua 1 (κ)- 1 (κ)- 1 - 1 , tibiae 9 ( 2 φ)- 8 (φ)- 8 (φ)- 7 (φ), tarsi 10 (ω 3 )- 9 (ω 3 )- 8 (ω 3 )- 8 (ω 3 ). Legs setae as indicated in
Figs 16–23
. Genual setae III–IV longer than I–II (
Figs. 16–19
). The length of genual setae Ge I <Ge II <Ge III <Ge IV.

Remarks.
Neophyllobius kamalii
closely resembles
N. karabagiensis
Akyol & Koç, 2006
in having the same femora, genua and tibiae setal formulae, but differs from the latter in the lengths of the following dorsal setae: ve 63 , sci 67 , sce 69 , c
1
95 , d
1
87 ,
e
1
75
and f
1
52 in the new species but ve 42 sci 44 , sce 39 , c
1
39 , d
1
42 ,
e
1
31
and f
1
26 in
N. karabagiensis
.

Etymology. This species is named in honor of Prof. Karim Kamali, Department of Agricultural Entomology, Faculty of Agriculture, Tarbiat Modarres University, Iran , for his great contribution on the foundation of acarological science in last two decades.

subSubSection.paragraph:
Type materials.
Holotype male and four paratype males from pomegranate leaves infested with
Cenopalpus irani Dosse
( Tenuipalpidae ), Shalan water spring, Dalahoo, Rijab, Kermanshah province, Iran ( 35 ° 17 ' 47 '' N, 46 ° 59 ' 09'' E, 1648 m a.s.l.),
12 December 2005
, Ahmad Babakfard.

The type materials are preserved as slide mounted specimens and the holotype male and three paratypes are deposited in the Acari Collection of the Department of Plant Protection, Faculty of Agriculture, University of Bu-Ali Sina , Hamedan, Iran and one paratype male is deposited in the Arachnida Collection of ARC-Plant Protection Research Institute, Pretoria, South Africa .
